frontmatter.description: Firefox Student Ambassadors (FSA) are college students who share the same passion in Mozilla’s mission in building a better internet. They are one of the most important contributors of Mozilla, by inspiring and educating students like them and even adults that they can make the web a better place for the benefit of all web users. They are the next generation leaders and Web innovators.
frontmatter.title: FSA Leaders Camp 2013

frontmatter.description: Software expo is one of the coolest event of School of Computer Studies and Technology, one of the school department at Colegio de San Juan de Letran Calamba (my Alma mater), its goal is to empower their students on the latest trend of technology through seminars and to showcase the talents of their students by means of exhibits. Some student put on display their robots with awesome functionality; while the other shows the systems they developed that will give its users a convenient way in doing their tasks.
frontmatter.title: Mozilla at SCST Software Expo 2013

frontmatter.description: STI is one of the best computer schools in the Philippines. Though its area of expertise is technology related, they also offer other programs such as: Business and Management, Engineering, and a lot more. Thanks to our Firefox Student Ambassadors (FSA) in STI Novaliches for organizing the Campus tour last September 28, in that way, Mozilla Philippines Community  share insights about the Open Web, Mozilla products, Firefox OS in their campus.  So far, STI Novaliches is the biggest STI campus I’ve encountered and has the largest number of audience that I talked to.
frontmatter.title: MozTour STI College Novaliches

frontmatter.description: Last September 27 we had a Workshop on App development for Firefox OS at the University of the East Manila. It was attended by the computer engineering students and some professors of the campus. Mozilla Philippines representatives and volunteers present in the event are Mr. Aaron Cajes, Mr. Kemuel Domanog, Mr. Marcus Ang , Mr. Kristian Lugtu and me.
frontmatter.title: Firefox OS Apps Development Workshop at UE Manila
